thread.title: ILO Pacific Island countries Director reaffirms commitments to Palau
thread.title_full: ILO Pacific Island countries Director reaffirms commitments to Palau

author: peterb@ilo.org
title: ILO Pacific Island countries Director reaffirms commitments to Palau
text:
News item
ILO Pacific Island countries Director reaffirms commitments to Palau
11 July 2024
Koror, Palau (ILO News) - The International Labour Organization (ILO) has strengthened its commitment to advancing labour standards in Palau, marked by the official presentation of credentials by Mr. Martin Wandera, the newly appointed Director for the ILO Office for Pacific Island Countries, who took office in March 2024. This visit underscores the ongoing collaboration between Palau and the ILO in promoting decent work and sustainable development for the people of Palau.
During his visit, Director Wandera presented his credentials to Honourable Ngiraibelas Tmetuchl, Minister for Human Resources, Culture, Tourism, and Development. He expressed gratitude for Palau's continued partnership with the ILO, emphasizing the organization's dedication to supporting Palau's efforts in promoting social justice and creating decent work opportunities. Director Wandera highlighted the importance of inclusive and sustainable economic growth, underpinned by the development of the National Employment Policy and other ongoing initiatives. He underscored the pivotal role of labour standards in achieving sustainable development goals.
Minister Tmetuchl warmly welcomed Director Wandera, acknowledging the ILO’s commitment to assisting Palau in addressing emerging challenges and opportunities, particularly in youth and community development.
Director Wandera also met with Tripartite partners, including the Palau Nurses Association and the Palau Chamber of Commerce, reaffirming the ILO’s commitment to strengthening and improving the capacity of its constituents to provide services to their members.
Through tailored initiatives and programs, the ILO continues to support Palau's efforts in achieving sustainable development and equitable opportunities for all its citizens.
For more information contact:
